results.title: Women Have Been Misled About Menopause
results.abstract: Hot flashes, sleeplessness, pain during sex: For some of menopause’s worst symptoms, there’s an established treatment. Why aren’t more women offered it?

results.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Tamir Kalifa
results.title: A Copper Mine Could Advance Green Energy but Scar Sacred Land
results.abstract: Tribal groups are fighting an Arizona project whose backers say increasing the supply of copper, crucial to batteries, would reduce fossil-fuel use.

media.caption: Wendsler Nosie, a former San Carlos Apache tribal chairman, is leading the legal fight against the proposed Resolution copper mine near Superior, Ariz.

results.title: They Call Her the Godmother of Southern Seeds for a Reason
results.abstract: For a quarter of a century, Ira Wallace has nurtured seeds and gardeners: ‘When you say her name in our community, all this love comes up.’

media.caption: Ira Wallace, 74, has played a key role at Southern Exposure Seed Exchange for about 25 years, and is referred to by those she has mentored as a godmother.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Ovarian Cancer;Women and Girls;Genetics and Heredity;Research;Cancer;Surgery and Surgeons;Preventive Medicine
results.title: To Prevent Cancer, More Women Should Consider Removing Fallopian Tubes, Experts Say
results.abstract: A top research group is urging even women without genetic risks to have their fallopian tubes removed under certain circumstances.

media.caption: Monica Monfre Scantlebury had multiple surgeries after discovering she carried a genetic mutation that raised the risk of ovarian and breast cancer. “I am named after my grandmother, and I believe the surgery prevented me from having the same obituary as her,” she said.
media.copyright: Jenn Ackerman for The New York Times

results.title: Those Window Stickers to Prevent Bird Strikes? There’s a Catch.
results.abstract: Every year, hundreds of millions of birds die in the United States from flying into glass. New research shows how to prevent some of those deaths.

media.caption: Other big threats to birds: Habitat lost to development, climate change and hunting by cats.

results.title: The College Board Strips Down Its A.P. Curriculum for African American Studies
results.abstract: The official course looks different from a previous draft: No more critical race theory, and the study of contemporary topics — like Black Lives Matter — is optional.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida banned the A.P. course, after a draft curriculum was leaked.

results.title: Juan Carrito, Italy’s Beloved Brown Bear, Dies in Traffic Accident
results.abstract: The 3-year-old rare Apennine brown bear was killed Monday night. He had become a celebrity because of his forays into human habitats.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Black People;Content Type: Personal Profile;Gavin, Cy (1985- );Gagosian Gallery;Sargent's Daughters (Manhattan, NY, Gallery);Dutchess County (NY)
results.title: A Modern Take on the Hudson River School Tradition
results.abstract: In his first show at Gagosian, opening Thursday, the painter Cy Gavin explores the land that has both empowered and inspired him.

media.caption: Cy Gavin at Gagosian in Chelsea with “Untitled (Paths, crossing -- blue),” at left, a nocturnal scene, and “Untitled (Baldcypress).” The painter sees himself as a steward of the land in New York’s Hudson Valley.
media.copyright: Victor Llorente for The New York Times
